    "comment": [
        "All numbers generated by the irreducible polynomial 2*n^3-2*n+9 are composite (indeed, they are multiples of 3). Largest prime factor A127990, smallest prime factor A127991, number of prime factors A127992."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A127989/b127989.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>",
        "<a href=\"/index/Rec#order_04\">Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients</a>, signature (4,-6,4,-1)."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = 2*(n-1)*n*(n+1)+9 = 3*(2*A007290(n+1)+3).",
        "G.f.: 3*x*(3-5*x+9*x^2-3*x^3)/(1-x)^4. - _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 09 2011",
        "a(n) = 4*a(n-1)-6*a(n-2)+4*a(n-3)-a(n-4). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 11 2021"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Table[2x^3 - 2x + 9, {x, 1, 100}]",
        "LinearRecurrence[{4,-6,4,-1}, {9, 21, 57, 129}, 50] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 08 2018 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(Magma) [2*(n-1)*n*(n+1)+9: n in [1..50]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 13 2011",
